data.title: Small Gem in the heart of Fayetteville
data.text: My wife and I visited the Gilbert on multiple occasions.  I really enjoyed everything about this theater.  It is quaint and inviting.  The people that run the facility are always uplifting and the shows they perform in are very entertaining.

data.title: Good Night of Entertainment
data.text: Down in Fayetteville visiting a job site and decided to check out the local theater. We saw a great production of "Hedda Gabler" - some really fine acting and the staff was so incredibly warm and inviting. I really liked that there were "free" refreshments working with a donation vs. charging $10 for a candy bar, at some places! The production budget was small but really it was a worthwhile performance and I highly recommend a visit!

data.title: Young Frankstein the musical
data.text: This was our second visit to the Gilbert and we had the best time. Last year we saw a Christmas Carol and put it on our future must do again list. The Theater is easy to find and parking is everywhere. The interior is simple and actually very comfortable. The restrooms are in the childrens play area. Being new to plays we are amazed at all they could do with a few simple pieces of furniture  The backdrops were very cool and set the mood. Look up the website and check out a  event. It will time wel spent

data.title: Good quality performances at reasonable prices
data.text: The Gilbert Theater presents live plays by pretty good actors at reasonable prices. You can save money by purchasing season tickets. Refreshments (including wine) are free, although they ask for a donation. I have always been able to find parking. It is located within walking distance of Hay Street. Shops and restaurants are close by. It is in the same building as the children's museum.
